title: Wild Stallion Mountain – The Bombay Royale
brief_description: Melbourne band The Bombay Royale make “vintage Bollywood-inspired surf, spy, disco and funk” and their video for Wild Stallion Mountain (2015) clearly reflects that, playing like a mash-up of Bollywood, 60s psychedelia, kitsch, exploitation cinema and classic Hollywood Westerns.

constellations_primary.name: Wild Stallion Mountain: Genre Mash-ups
constellations_primary.description: The Bombay Royale are known for combining funk, disco and pop with the sounds of classical Indian music together with the soundtracks of Bollywood cinema. Their music videos similarly hybridise  genres and styles to create intoxicating visual mash-ups.

description: Wearing their influences firmly on their sleeve, Melbourne band The Bombay Royale make “vintage Bollywood-inspired surf, spy, disco and funk” and their video for ‘Wild Stallion Mountain’ (2015) clearly reflects that. With both their sound and style linked very closely to movies, the music clip plays like a visual mash-up of their various inspirations including Bollywood, 60s psychedelia, the kitsch, exploitation cinema and classic Hollywood Westerns.
description_for_label: Wearing their influences firmly on their sleeve, Melbourne band The Bombay Royale make “vintage Bollywood-inspired surf, spy, disco and funk” and their video for ‘Wild Stallion Mountain’ (2015) clearly reflects that. With both their sound and style linked very closely to movies, the music clip plays like a visual mash-up of their various inspirations including Bollywood, 60s psychedelia, the kitsch, exploitation cinema and classic Hollywood Westerns.

images.alt_text: A woman of indian descent wearing a costume like that of the french aristocracy, frilly clothes and a platinum wig, looking down mid song with a undulating background of green and blue that hints at a landscape
